extendedIngredients.name: arborio rice
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup uncooked Carnaroli or Arborio rice or other medium-grain rice
extendedIngredients.originalName: uncooked Carnaroli or Arborio rice or other medium-grain rice

extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided

extendedIngredients.name: parmigiano reggiano cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup (2 ounces) grated fresh Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined

title: Pan-Seared Shrimp and Arugula Risotto
summary: The recipe Pan-Seared Shrimp and Arugula Risotto is ready in about 45 minutes and is definitely a tremendous gluten free and pescatarian option for lovers of Mediterranean food. For $3.14 per serving, you get a main course that serves 6. One serving contains 389 calories, 26g of protein, and 14g of fat. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have shrimp, garlic cloves, pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 42%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes include Lemony Shrimp And Arugula Risotto, Lemony Shrimp And Arugula Risotto, and Shrimp with Arugula Pesto Risotto.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Anne Amie Pinot Gris with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Anne Amie Pinot Gris
productMatches.description:
Aromas of Bartlett pear, gardenia, white peach, white tea, jasmine, graham cracker, and straw. Flavors of Asian pear, white fig, white peach, white strawberry, and fennel flowers. The finish is dry, long and acid driven.
Pairs well with roast chicken, Caesar salad, mussels, quince glazed pork chop, grilled squash, pan seared trout, and bibimbap.

instructions: Bring Homemade Chicken Stock to a simmer in a small saucepan (do not boil). Keep warm over low heat.                                                                                                 Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle shrimp with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add shrimp to pan; cook 1 minute. Remove pan from heat; set aside.                                                                                                 Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and garlic to pan; cook 5 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently. Add rice; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in wine; cook 1 minute or until the liquid is nearly absorbed, stirring constantly. Add 1 cup stock; cook 4 minutes or until liquid is nearly absorbed, stirring constantly. Stir in remaining stock, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring frequently until each portion of stock is absorbed before adding the next (about 25 minutes total). Stir in shrimp; cook 1 minute or until done. Stir in cheese, butter, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Remove from heat; stir in arugula and basil.

steps.step: Bring Homemade Chicken Stock to a simmer in a small saucepan (do not boil). Keep warm over low heat.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle shrimp with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Add shrimp to pan; cook 1 minute.
Remove pan from heat; set aside.
Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add shallots and garlic to pan; cook 5 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently.
Add rice; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in wine; cook 1 minute or until the liquid is nearly absorbed, stirring constantly.

Add 1 cup stock; cook 4 minutes or until liquid is nearly absorbed, stirring constantly. Stir in remaining stock, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring frequently until each portion of stock is absorbed before adding the next (about 25 minutes total). Stir in shrimp; cook 1 minute or until done. Stir in cheese, butter, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Remove from heat; stir in arugula and basil.
